chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Angela M. Polk was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Angela M. Polk was found guilty of Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Angela M. Polk was found guilty of OWI (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay $750 fine plus costs. 60 days to pay.

10 days of sentence are stayed. If Defendant attends the Victim Impact Panel scheduled for 6/8/17, stay will be permanent. If Defendant fails to attend, stay will be lifted. Good time and Huber privileges granted. 45 days to report.
Any vehicle driven by or registered to Defendant during period of IID restriction must be equipped with Ignition Interlock Device unless otherwise ordered by the Court.
Obtain alcohol assessment through Door County Human Services and comply with treatment recommendations.
Defendant is required to attend the Victim Impact Panel scheduled for 6/8/17.

Defendant Angela M. Polk in court with attorney Peter Raymond Heyne. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim AP appeared by phone. State advises of plea agreement. Court reviews whether pleas have been accepted. State makes statement. Court accepts pleas, finds Defendant guilty of Counts 3, 4, 5. Counts 1, 2, 6, 7 are dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Discussion regarding restitution, time to report. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Victim makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Partial transcript of hearing held 12/20/16

Defendant Angela M. Polk appeared by phone. Attorney Peter Raymond Heyne appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews letter from Defense regarding phone appearance. Defense requests time to review file, find out more about restitution. Court questions when Defendant can get here for sentencing. Defendant would need 45-60 days, has nothing, is in a shelter, has to get a new place to live. State requests proof of excuse for not being here in December and for today's proceeding. Defendant has absolutely no problem doing that. Court impresses upon Defendant the requirement to be here in person. Defendant advises she will be here if she's not dead. Court wants proof of accident in December and why not here today as soon as possible.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 4, 2017 at 09:00 am.
from Defense requesting phone appearance for Defendant. Per Court, granted.
Defendant's physical address is 4512 Papania Dr, Apt. 22, New Orleans, LA 70127

Defendant Angela M. Polk appeared by phone. Attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant was in an accident two weeks ago, has her jaw wired shut. Defense advises of Defendant's financial difficulties, requests that Court not issue warrant today. Defendant cannot fly for 2 weeks or work for 4 weeks. Court questions how long Defendant will need to complete conditions to get felony amended to misdemeanor. State advises that option has passed, advises of jail time that will be required. Defendant makes statement regarding trying to serve jail in Louisiana, is afraid she'll lose her job, has been involved in custody battle. Defense requests date in February. State makes statement regarding restitution, requests date as soon as possible. Discussion regarding when Defendant can get here.  Status conference scheduled for February 9, 2017 at 09:15 am.
from Defense advising that Defendant cannot afford transportation from Louisiana, requesting adjournment. Per Court, granted.
Sentencing hearing on December 20, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Angela M. Polk in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests that Court go through plea, withhold finding Defendant guilty, set off adjudication and sentencing for about 120 days to allow Defendant time to complete conditions that would get felony amended to misdemeanor. State agrees. Court reviews plea agreement, charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 3, 4, 5. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, withholds acceptance of pleas. Bond continues as is.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on July 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Angela M. Polk appeared by phone from Louisiana. Attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers appeared in Court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of Defendant's family issues, requests scheduling during week when she doesn't have the children so she doesn't have to buy 4 plane tickets.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Angela M. Polk appeared by phone. Attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant is not back from Louisiana, has reviewed discovery, but needs to review it with Defendant, questions when Defendant will be back. Defendant thinks she will be back within 60 days. If not resolved, case will be set for trial.  Status conference scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Status conference set for February 11, 2015 at 10:30. Bond continues as is.

Prior: 919 Alabama Pl # 8, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

Defendant Angela M. Polk appeared by video conference. Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 11/30/15, 10:00.
